message_1:
A study was conducted to compare the final exam scores of students in three different courses - Math, Science, and English. The mean scores and standard deviations for each course are obtained as follows:

Math: Mean = 73, SD = 8
Science: Mean = 81, SD = 12
English: Mean = 77, SD = 10

A new student has scored 75 on the final exam. Determine which course the student is most likely to belong to. Use discriminant analysis assuming equal prior probabilities.
message_2:
To determine which course the student is most likely to belong to, we will use the discriminant function for each course and compare the values. The discriminant function is given by:

D(x) = (x - μ) / σ

where x is the student's score, μ is the mean score for the course, and σ is the standard deviation for the course.

For Math:
D_Math = (75 - 73) / 8 = 2 / 8 = 0.25

For Science:
D_Science = (75 - 81) / 12 = -6 / 12 = -0.5

For English:
D_English = (75 - 77) / 10 = -2 / 10 = -0.2

Now we compare the discriminant values:

D_Math = 0.25
D_Science = -0.5
D_English = -0.2

The highest discriminant value is for Math (0.25), so the student is most likely to belong to the Math course.
